result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Final status/scheduling conference on February 14, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on February 20, 2023 at 08:45 am.

[MK] cases #21CF65, #22CF85, #22CF170 called at 2:57pm 
Defendant Rhonda M. Costilla in court with Attorney John Chavez. ADA Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Chavez indicates that the trial-related dates set in case #22CF85 should remain in place.
Counsel propose scheduling case #22CF170 for jury trial. The Court sets trial in February, noting that after January 1st the case will be assigned to Judge Hue/Branch II. 
recess 3:02pm.
[Post-Hearing, in response to the clerk's inquiry, Ms. Costilla verifies that the 1123 Maple Street address remains current.] 

NEXT:  (1) remove the Jail from the mailing matrix- Ms. Costilla is no longer in custody, (2) in case #21CF85 the December 5th FSSC and the December 12th Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar,  (3) schedule cases #21CF65 and #22CF170 for Status Conference on December 5th,  (3) FSSC in case #22CF170 and Status Conference in case #22CF65 on February 14th at 3:30pm,  (4) Jury Trial in case #22CF170 on February 20th at 8:45am

Defendant Rhonda M. Costilla in court, in custody.  Attorney John A. Chavez in court for Rhonda M. Costilla.  Attorney Michael C. Witt in court for State of Wisconsin.

[ma] Cases 21CF65, 22CF85, 22CF170 called at 8:56am 
Defendant Rhonda M. Costilla in court, in custody.  Attorney John A. Chavez in court for Rhonda M. Costilla.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

State maintains speedy trial demand in Case 22CF85; scheduling is discussed; State waives time limits until 10/31/22 date.

Arraignment occurs in Case 22CF170:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Defendant stands mute, pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:06am 

NEXT:   As to Case 22CF85, (1) FSSC on 10/25/22 at 2:30pm    (2) Jury Trial on 10/31/22 at 8:15am (speedy demand pends)
As to Cases 21CF65 & 22CF170, Status on 10/25/22 at 2:30pm
Arraignment on July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] cases #21CF65, #22CF85, #22CF170 called at 8:39am 
Defendant Rhonda M. Costilla in court, in custody, with Attorney John Chavez. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.  
In Case #22CF170 Prelim Waiver occurs:  
--  Ms. Costilla waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
Attorney Chavez requests to defer Arraignment to a different date.

NEXT:  Arraignment in Case #22CF170 and Status Conference in the other cases-all on July 29th at 8:30am
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Conditions of Bond include: 

---no contact with Victim 1 (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 

---no unsupervised contact with any minor (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.)

[MK] cases #21CF65, #22CF85, #22CF170 called at 1:31pm 
Defendant Rhonda M. Costilla in court, in custody, with Attorney John Chavez. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.  

In Case #22CF85 Prelim Waiver & Arraignment are held:   
---Ms. Costilla waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
---Service of the Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--the Defense stands mute; pleas of "not guilty" entered by the Court on the Defendant's behalf
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
_______________
In Case #22CF170 Initial Appearance is held:  
---Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
---Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
---The Court requires a $5,000 Cash Bond, with conditions: 
---no contact with Victim 1
---no unsupervised contact with any minor 
recess 2:00pm 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on May 11th at 11:00am,  (2)  Preliminary Hearing in Case #22CF170 and Status Conference in the other cases--all on June 17th at 8:30am
